did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes correspondence, published material, and several manuscripts.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Jussawalla is an Indian poet, critic, and a man of letters. Together with Arvind Krishna Mehrotra he founded the Clearing House press that brought literary modernism to India.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, published material, and several manuscripts.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Adil Jussawalla Papers, #8519. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Related material located in collection #8511, Arvind Krishna Mehrotra papers.

scopecontent.p: Anthology of Indian prose in English
Includes one letter from 1986
Most of the documents were created in 1979; Editor was S.V. Vasuder)
Continuation of dealings with Indian Express, as Sunday Standard is its supplement
Includes packets of unpublished works
Includes Gauri Deshpande's letters regarding the "boycott on a USIS programme taking part in 1971" (Bangladesh Liberation War)
Includes an apology letter addressed to "Farida Peddar" (1986)
